title: Excise policy scam: Delhi High Court denies bail to AAP's Manish Sisodia in CBI case
selftext:
"The allegations are very serious in nature. The accused was a public servant... We have not examined the excise policy nor the power of the government. However, the applicant being a powerful person, there is the possibility of him influencing the witnesses," the Court said.

I saw other articles regarding the same, media specifically omitted this line. 

My question when is the bail decision being just taken based on influence - How can court say we have not reviewed the file or even power of the Government?

What justice system are we living in? On one side a Rape Accused is not sent to Jail, on the other hand court for a case with no proof yet as of now, doesn't even have time to review files related to granting bail to a person. 

I feel Delhi Courts are just equivalent to Gujarat Courts? A totally biased point of view of the ruling party. 

Other article I checked:

https://www.livemint.com/news/india/excise-policy-scam-delhi-high-court-denies-bail-to-aap-leader-manish-sisodia-11685424452094.html
comments:
Another is issue is one can't openly speak about a judge or decision by a judge especially if it is related to BJP.

The media can play this by creating a pressure on Judiciary but they are playing the game of hide the truth, spread the lies. 

The same happened with Bilkis Bano, the same is happening with Wrestlers Protest and the same is happening with Manipur. 

All parties are afraid to go to District or High Courts of specific state -

It seems that joining BJP will be one of the points when presenting the case to a Judge as it will mean that you have the privilege to be listened else you will be malled down until you yourself give up.
BJP has weaponized Judiciary and pretty much all of Indian institutions
The hon. judge took 20 days to pronounce the bail judgement. Says he has not read the merits of the case and is denying bail because Sisodiya is an influential person.
